source_articles.title: Bitcoin ETF Exodus Hits $4B as Analysts Debate the Future of the Digital Gold Narrative - TipRanks
source_articles.body:
Bitcoin ETFs are facing a massive round of selling that refuses to let up. In the last five weeks alone, investors have pulled nearly $4 billion out of these funds, with $166 million leaving in just a single day this Thursday. This marks the third day in a row that more money has left the funds than entered. Despite this exit by big-money players, the actual price of Bitcoin (BTC-USD) has stayed surprisingly strong, holding steady around $67,800.
President's Day Sale - 70% Off
- Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
- Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential
Experts Predict a Reset for Bitcoin
Not everyone is worried about the billions of dollars leaving the market. Enmanuel Cardozo, an analyst at Brickken, believes this isn’t a sign that big banks are giving up on Bitcoin. Instead, he sees it as a natural recalibration after a very successful 2025. He explained that many short-term traders are simply taking their profits while the global economy remains uncertain. He told Decrypt: “This does not resemble institutional capitulation.”
Cardozo pointed out that the money leaving is still just a small fraction of the total assets held in these ETFs. In his view, once the “weak hands” finish selling, the market will stabilize and find its footing again.
Bitcoin Struggles Against the Rise of AI and Gold
While some are optimistic, other analysts are sounding a note of caution. Illia Otychenko from CEX.IO noted that Bitcoin is currently fighting two big battles at once. First, the recent “rally in gold” has made the traditional metal look more attractive than digital gold to safe-haven investors. Second, the massive boom in AI technology has pulled speculative money away from crypto and into tech stocks.
Otychenko warned that these ETF outflows are acting like an amplifier of market weakness. He believes that unless Bitcoin can show a confident shift back into a bullish trend, the outflows could continue for a while longer.
Markets Signal a Possible 44% Jump in BTC Price to $84,000
Despite the red numbers in the ETF reports, the on-chain mood is starting to improve. On prediction markets like Myriad, users are becoming more hopeful, giving Bitcoin a 44% chance of rallying to $84,000 in the near future. This suggests that while institutional paper funds are selling, the actual users and believers in the crypto space are starting to look for a bottom. If Bitcoin can hold its current levels while the bleeding from ETFs stops, it could set the scene for a massive spring recovery.

source_articles.title: Glassnode: Bitcoin ETF To Unlock $70B in New Demand - CoinMarketCap
source_articles.body:
A new report predicts up to $70 billion could pour into Bitcoin if a spot ETF is approved.
Glassnode estimates that up to $70 billion in new capital could flow into the Bitcoin market after the approval of a spot Bitcoin ETF. This projection is based on the assumption that 10% of money currently invested in major stock and bond ETFs would shift to a Bitcoin ETF, along with 5% of capital allocated to gold ETFs.
Source: Glassnode
The report points to diminishing Bitcoin supply available for trading to meet this potential demand surge. Glassnode data shows the percentage of the Bitcoin supply held by short-term investors recently hit multi-year lows. Meanwhile, the share of long-term Bitcoin holders reached all-time highs above 76% in October.
"The scarcity of readily tradable Bitcoin may amplify market volatility and price movements in response to the influx of ETF-driven capital," the Glassnode report concludes.
U.S. regulators have yet to approve a spot Bitcoin ETF. Approval could significantly expand access and demand for Bitcoin from institutional investors.
Glassnode suggests a spot Bitcoin ETF could have impacts comparable to the first U.S. gold ETF launched in 2003. In the decade that followed, gold prices rose over 400% amid greater investment demand.

source_articles.body:
U.S. Bitcoin ETF Holdings Contract With $1.6B Monthly Outflows

- The U.S. spot Bitcoin ETF balances saw a significant drop in January as investors withdrew around $1.6 billion from these funds.
- The fall in the funds marks the continuation of the outflow trend, resulting in many investors experiencing losses.
The U.S. spot Bitcoin exchange-traded funds saw substantial net outflows in January, which enables investment exposure to BTC. According to data from SoSoValue, shows that around $1.6 billion left the ETF products in January. This is a continuation of a series of outflows that began in late 2025. The ETF managers withdrew the funds as more redemptions piled up over a number of days.
The Glassnode statistics showed that the total spot Bitcoin ETF holdings decreased by around 100,300 BTC since October. As of late February, the total holdings of ETFs were close to 1.26 million BTC. This marked the biggest drawdown of the current market cycle. Bitcoin prices were lower in early 2026, trading close to $67,000 after hitting a record high of above $126,000 in late 2025.
The pressing factors of a fall in BTC prices and market volatility led certain investors to unwind their risk positions. The trend of outflows reflected a sense of caution among institutional and retail investors. It was noted that higher fear and lower risk appetite were linked to larger ETF outflows.
The average entry price for spot Bitcoin ETF investors was roughly $83,980 per BTC, leading to unrealized losses for the majority of investors. Extended redemptions were not only seen in Bitcoin ETFs but also in other digital asset funds. It was noticed that digital asset investment products saw total outflows of nearly $3.7 billion in the past weeks. Notwithstanding this, cumulative ETF inflows since inception continued to be of historical significance.
Institutional Trends and Market Cycles
The U.S. spot Bitcoin ETFs started with considerable institutional investment, which led to early adoption and integration with the traditional financial system. This led to total cumulative investments reaching close to $53 billion. However, high volatility and price corrections led to a rotation out of risk assets. Analysts have indicated that periodic outflows are a normal market cycle and not indicative of institutional withdrawal.
ETF balances’ inflows and subsequent redemptions show the dynamic nature of capital inflows. The drawdown of the ETF balances also reflects the weakness in the digital asset markets. The flow of funds into spot ETFs is also linked to market sentiment and risk appetite. The persistent outflow of funds is also linked to risk-off periods. However, the trend of accumulating ETFs is important and reflects the current reality compared to the initial projections.

source_articles.title: The Factors that Affect Ethereum Value - The Florida Times-Union
source_articles.body:
The Factors that Affect Ethereum Value
The Ethereum network now works differently, with a proof-of-stake mechanism in place.
Ethereum’s value, or Ethereum price as can be seen on crypto exchanges like Binance, is influenced by network fundamentals, supply and demand, technological adoption, decentralized finance (DeFi) activity, and macroeconomic factors. Its value is also changing as it migrates to Ethereum 2.0, undergoes network upgrades, and as more institutions express interest in it.
Supply, Staking, and Ethereum 2.0
With Ethereum 2.0, called the Merge, Ethereum changed from proof-of-work to proof-of-stake. This added staking, which effectively locks coins out of circulation, reduces the coin supply, and supports Ethereum’s price. EIP-1559 and other network upgrades introduced fee-burning mechanisms that gradually reduce Ethereum’s circulating supply, supporting long-term price appreciation.
The Ethereum network now works differently, with a proof-of-stake mechanism in place. Following the Merge, validators are required to stake their ETH rather than rely on energy-intensive mining, which improved network performance and reduced the rate at which new tokens are released. Staking rewards motivate network participants to lock up their ETH, decreasing the circulating supply. This can create what some analysts refer to as a “supply shock,” which may support price stability or appreciation when demand remains steady or increases.
Demand from DeFi, NFTs, and Business Acceptance
Most DeFi platforms and NFT marketplaces are built on Ethereum. When more people use them, it increases network demand, which can affect the price of Ethereum. As more institutional capital, treasury allocations, and ETFs begin to adopt ETH, it can exert upward pressure on the price over time, particularly as it becomes part of a broader range of investment portfolios.
The Ethereum DeFi ecosystem has grown significantly. Lending protocols, decentralized exchanges, and yield-generating platforms all require ETH for transaction fees and collateral. This demand stems from actual use and economic activity, not speculation. NFT marketplaces also rely on Ethereum’s infrastructure. Previously, when interest in digital collectibles was higher, the demand for ETH also rose.
Institutional participation has shifted from passive observation to active involvement. The introduction of Ethereum ETFs and the incorporation of ETH into corporate treasury strategies indicate a wider acceptance beyond retail investors. These institutional inflows may help stabilize prices over longer periods of time.
Metrics of Usage and Network Activity
Metrics such as the number of daily transactions, active addresses, and smart contract deployments indicate a network’s usefulness and popularity. More activity on the network usually means a higher Ethereum price.
The amount of ETH staked or locked in DeFi also limits the amount available for trading, thereby indirectly affecting the price of Ethereum. Experts have said that “network usage and smart contract activity are key drivers for Ethereum’s valuation, reflecting real demand beyond speculation.”
Crypto Culture
There are many similarities between the crypto market and the stock market, which is best observed on Wall Street. When they first emerged, both were met with skepticism and disapproval from mainstream audiences. Over time, they became well known and part of popular culture. Both markets offer investment opportunities that involve varying levels of risk, but they attract investors with different financial goals. Most importantly, both the crypto and stock markets have built up very dedicated groups of participants and observers.
For a long time, Wall Street has been home to a community of people who make a living by buying and selling stocks. Today, there is a similar group of people around cryptocurrency, who are often referred to as “crypto bros.” Like Wall Street brokers, crypto bros spend their time watching the value of th

source_articles.title: Understanding the Relationship Between Ethereum Price and DeFi/NFT Adoption - The Desert Sun
source_articles.body:
Understanding the Relationship Between Ethereum Price and DeFi/NFT Adoption
Unlike Bitcoin, which is often seen as a store of value, Ethereum primarily acts as a platform for supporting DeFi and NFT systems.
Ethereum (ETH) is one of the most popular cryptocurrencies today. Most people familiar with the crypto world know its name. Unlike Bitcoin, which is often seen as a store of value, Ethereum primarily acts as a platform for supporting DeFi and NFT systems. These systems come in different shapes and sizes, but many play a role in influencing the Ethereum price. This is because transactions, collateral, and smart contracts on the network require ETH.
By establishing a basic understanding of the relationship between DeFi/NFT adoption and Ethereum price, prospective users can approach decentralized markets with the knowledge needed to recognize how and why real network utility affects short-term price movements and long-term valuation.
Defining Terms: DeFi and NFTs
As a brief reminder, DeFi, short for decentralized finance, pertains to a financial system that operates via blockchain technology. An article notes that, unlike traditional finance, “DeFi is entirely decentralized. This means that it is not controlled by a central entity or government. Instead, it relies on open protocols and smart contracts on the Ethereum blockchain.”
Because DeFi applications are not tied to any one entity, they can be accessed from anywhere, at any time, by anyone, all without needing a standard bank account. Additionally, by using blockchain technology, DeFi programs are able to offer complete transparency and substantial security.
Non-fungible tokens (NFTs), meanwhile, are assets like digital content, videos, or artworks that have been tokenized by way of a blockchain. These tokens can be traded and exchanged on platforms in networks like Ethereum for money, cryptocurrencies, or even other NFTs. Not every exchange platform accepts NFTs, but some DeFi applications do. This opens up new opportunities for financial transactions and investments on the Ethereum blockchain.
The Role of Ethereum Price in DeFi Protocols
ETH, the native token of Ethereum, is often used as collateral in decentralized lending, borrowing, and yield protocols. In these cases, this means that the value of your collateral goes up or down with the price of Ethereum. It is important to note that more DeFi activity often makes it harder to get liquid ETH. This puts upward pressure on the price of Ethereum because of demand.
Different DeFi protocols always react to these changes in different ways. For instance, decentralized exchange protocols like Uniswap let people trade ETH and ERC-20 tokens, while protocols like DAI make decentralized stablecoins that are worth the same as the US dollar. The protocol that interacts more directly with ETH will probably have a stronger connection to changes in price than protocols that are less connected to ETH.
Important Shifts in NFT Market Activity
With NFTs gradually gaining recurring popularity, possibly thanks to the increasing number of DeFi protocols and platforms on Ethereum, their value in relation to changes in ETH pricing has become more notable over time. This development is largely due to the fact that NFT minting, trading, and royalty-sharing are primarily executed in ETH. As a result, a surge in NFT adoption can coincide with short-term spikes in Ethereum price due to higher transactional demand.
As it so happens, these short-term spikes also provide traders with useful information that can be used to inform short-term price indicators. By monitoring NFT and DeFi market cycles, traders can sometimes gauge how current trends line up with past ones, thereby providing them with some means of predicting price changes for the near future.
How Real-World Utility Signals Adoption
Much of the trading done on crypto markets is speculative since cryptocurrencies (outside of stablecoins) may have little inherent value. This speculation pl

source_articles.title: The Little Ethereum That Could: Why Use Drives Ethereum’s Price - Asbury Park Press
source_articles.body:
The Little Ethereum That Could: Why Use Drives Ethereum’s Price
For something unique like Ethereum (ETH), which is designed to be a decentralized utility, you have to look beyond the simple charts.
The price on any asset always comes down to something simple: its supply and demand. But for something unique like Ethereum (ETH), which is designed to be a decentralized utility, you have to look beyond the simple charts to see what’s really generating that demand and moving the Ethereum price.
Of course, the general state of the economy and market sentiment matter, but typically, the price of ETH moves largely due to the actual work occurring on its blockchain. Real-world adoption, usage, and general utility, all tracked by on-chain data, affect the ebb and flow of ETH, showing it’s not just a coin to trade but the essential fuel needed for a growing and decentralized digital world.
How to Measure Real Demand
A good way to check the health and usefulness of the Ethereum network is by looking at its daily transaction volume. Every single action that’s taken, whether it’s a simple transfer, a complicated interaction in decentralized finance (DeFi), or creating a new non-fungible token (NFT), requires a small amount of ETH to pay for the computing power, which is generally referred to as the “gas fees.”
Daily on-chain transactions are a direct measure of how much the network is being used. High transaction volumes mean a lot of people are actively taking advantage of what the network can do. Greater usage indicates stronger utility and oftentimes, demand for the network, which naturally makes ETH more valuable and useful. This increase in activity often pushes the ETH price higher, highlighting a link between network activity and market value.
How Many People Are Using It?
The number of unique active addresses is a good way to tell how widely the network is being used, not just how many transactions are happening. The count of different addresses making transactions on any given day reflects the engagement from individual people, large organizations, and the many smart contracts that power the decentralized web.
“Ethereum is entering one of its most powerful phases yet, combining deep institutional interest with unprecedented levels of on-chain activity,” an article states. When the number of active addresses keeps going up, it’s a strong sign of genuine network adoption. It means that more participants are entering the Ethereum world for whatever reason, be that to buy ETH to hold, use applications, mint NFTs, or build their own smart contracts. Since everyone needs ETH to pay for their activity, this growth can raise the ETH price because, as demand for the network’s native currency increases, it becomes harder to distinguish organic growth from price movements driven by short-term speculation.
The Power of Smart Contracts
Probably Ethereum’s greatest innovation is its ability to run self-executing programs called smart contracts, which you might think of as the engine for decentralized applications (dApps). Ethereum's long-term value depends on how quickly new smart contracts are created and used, as well as how often people use the ones already there.
Smart contracts are the building blocks for everything, from NFT marketplaces and DeFi platforms to tokenized asset projects. The rising number of new contracts and high interaction volume highlight Ethereum’s usefulness as the world’s leading smart contract platform. As its usefulness grows, so does demand for ETH, the asset needed to run and maintain these apps. This, in turn, drives up the price of ETH.
DeFi and NFT Activity
Ethereum plays a significant role in the DeFi and NFT space. These activities greatly influence its price movement. Smart contracts create a constant need for ETH, both for collateral and transaction fees. The minting, trading, and selling of new NFTs also require ETH for each fee.
As DeFi protocols grow and NFT trading volumes rise, the demand for ETH goes u

source_articles.title: How NFTs and the Blockchain May Be Positioned to Impact the Gaming Industry - The Newark Advocate
source_articles.body:
How NFTs and the Blockchain May Be Positioned to Impact the Gaming Industry
With Solana and other cryptocurrencies, the blockchain is transforming modern financial markets. At the same time, the technology has opened new doors for digital assets. Non-fungible tokens (NFTs) are a prime example of this. They provide unique ownership options online and impact the Solana price, which is sitting at $103.5 at the time of writing Binance among other platforms. As such, NFTs promise to drive their own trends, which may be seen in the gaming industry.
What Are the Applications of NFTs Today?
The adoption of NFTs reached its height in 2021, largely due to high-profile sales and celebrity endorsement. Most of these token projects had to do with limited-release digital artworks, but these digital assets have since found new implementations. Though the NFT market has since gone through a significant correction period, it has newfound potential in several industries.
"NFTs go beyond mere collectibles," Nikita Sachdev wrote for the Forbes Business Council. "Their unique digital certificates can prove ownership of real or virtual items, like art, music, or even your car. Stored on a blockchain, they're like one-of-a-kind digital keys that can make buying, selling, and trading more efficient and secure, and reduce the possibility of counterfeits or fraud."
Rather than a focus on a distinctive art asset market, innovators and business leaders have leaned into the ownership and utility elements of NFT technology. This trend is especially true for the gaming industry, which has begun to use NFTs to promote true digital ownership of in-game assets. Not only does this empower the playerbase, but allows for the development of new revenue models.
NFTs and In-Game Digital Ownership
While NFT and crypto-based games have yet to take off, these Web3 initiatives promise a new form of ownership in online spaces. By no longer confining assets to centralized servers or allowing game publishers to restrict them, players can truly say that a skin, item, or in-game currency is their own. This is the ownership that NFT technology aims for, ultimately giving players greater control over their digital possessions.
There are already prominent games where skins, items, or in-game currencies are important to players. That said, players must always consider the possibility that these assets could be reclaimed by a publisher or otherwise influenced by a decision to change the system itself. One prominent example of such a decision recently took place on October 23, with an impactful change to Counter-Strike 2.
"Counter-Strike 2's October 23 update sent shockwaves through the skin trading community," Calum Patterson explained for Dexerto, "with significant impacts in the aftermath of a major change to how players can obtain knives and gloves."
Play-to-Earn and Tokenized Incentives
Rather than focusing strictly on NFT assets, certain blockchain-based games will reward players with tokens that can be used in-game. These tokens may be used to acquire NFT assets or unlock features and content. This approach shifts some control over the gaming ecosystem from developers, such as the team behind Counter-Strike 2, to the player community.
"Companies can use NFTs to offer unique rewards to their customers," Allie Grace Garnett wrote for Britannica Money. "An NFT can grant special access privileges, transfer ownership of a rare digital collectible, or create a personalized digital experience. Rewards that are tokenized into NFTs may also be transferred between users."
In this vein, there is a possibility that rewards tokens and full NFTs could function across multiple games and platforms. As such, interoperable systems may enable players to transfer their progress, identity, or in-game assets from one digital world to another. Lacking an NFT's capability to track ownership by means of the blockchain, this kind of advancement may not have otherwise been feasible.

source_articles.title: How the SOL to USD Rate Influences Web3 Developer Adoption on Solana - Record-Courier
source_articles.body:
How the SOL to USD Rate Influences Web3 Developer Adoption on Solana
As Web3 solutions grow in popularity, leading platforms like Solana (SOL) are attracting community developers and tech startups alike. By relying on its native cryptocurrency, these innovators benefit from faster speeds and lower transaction costs from SOL to USD. While more established players like Ethereum still hold the majority of attention in Web3, more developers than ever are considering Solana.
“Solana’s startup ecosystem has made significant gains in recent years,” Samuel Haig wrote for The Defiant, “now accounting for 18% of projects after dipping to 8% amid the aftermath of FTX’s collapse in late 2022.”
SOL to USD and Web3 Startups
According to 2024 data from the Alliance crypto accelerator program, about 80% of Web3 startups are building on either Ethereum or Solana. Between these two projects, Ethereum attracts 62% of ventures and Solana attracts 18%. Since 2022, however, Solana has begun to gradually close the gap. This momentum reflects significant potential for the platform, as well as any projects developed with it.
SOL to USD Versus ETH to USD
Ultimately, the differences between Solana and Ethereum come down to technical limitations and recency. As a market leader, Bitcoin’s prominence is tied solely to the valuation of its cryptocurrency; very few developers rely on its blockchain due to its inefficiency. Solana and Ethereum, on the other hand, are platforms dedicated to supporting Web3 development in realms like decentralized finance (DeFi).
To achieve greater efficiency, Solana and Ethereum adopted a different “proof of” model than Bitcoin’s original proof-of-work (PoW) solution. Today, Ethereum uses a proof of stake (PoS) model while Solana relies on a hybrid proof of history (PoH) and PoS solution. While the PoS system is faster and more efficient than PoW, Solana’s hybrid PoH and PoS is designed to outpace both.
“Much of the buzz surrounding Solana in 2021 was due to its distinct advantage over Ethereum in terms of transaction speed and processing costs,” Elvis Picardo wrote for Investopedia. “As of Sept. 18, 2024, Solana processed over 2,400 transactions per second, each costing $0.00026 on average. In contrast, Ethereum can handle fewer than 15 TPS, while average transaction fees are around $0.30.”
A Platform Built for Solana-Powered Web3
With processing times and low fees that outdo the competition by significant margins, many developers favor Solana for Web3 innovation. While its native cryptocurrency may not compare to leaders like Bitcoin and Ethereum in terms of strict valuation, the utility of Sol in on-platform cases is notable. In the end, what makes Solana different is that developers and startups like it.
For these reasons, it is perhaps unsurprising that Solana’s market share has grown significantly since 2022, suggesting developer interest, though Ethereum still attracts a significant volume of projects. While the platform’s status as a more established player has given it an advantage, Solana’s performance advantages will be hard to ignore moving forward. If Solana can continue to distinguish itself as an innovative solution, innovators are likely to continue this shift in direction.
“Solana is one of those cryptocurrencies that’s been buzzing for its speed and low fees,” a blog post for OneSafe explained. “But with great power comes great responsibility, or in this case, risk… Startups will need to pull out all the stops to manage the risks. Think about diversifying your assets, using stablecoins when you can, and not going all in on crypto. It’s a balancing act, but one that might pay off.”
Community Apps on Solana
Decentralized apps (dApps) have also gained significant attention recently, especially those with blockchain-based use cases. Applications in ticketing, local event management, and loyalty programs can be built using Solana’s native systems, and these startup tools serve to expand the platform beyond crypto

source_articles.body:
Supreme Court Tariffs Ruling Jolts Dow Jones Index
Investors react to a pivotal Supreme Court decision on tariffs as economic data and big corporate moves add volatility to the trading day.
Share
As the sun rose over New York City on February 20, 2026, all eyes turned to the New York Stock Exchange, where the opening bell signaled the start of a trading day charged with anticipation. The reason? A much-awaited Supreme Court ruling on tariffs—often referred to as the Trump tariffs—was set to reverberate through financial markets, and investors were bracing for impact.
According to live coverage from the New York Stock Exchange, the Dow Jones Index became a focal point for traders and analysts alike, as they tried to gauge the immediate fallout from the high-stakes decision. The Supreme Court’s ruling, which had been keenly anticipated by market participants, was expected to set the tone for not just the day, but potentially the weeks ahead.
Early in the trading day, Dow Jones futures dipped slightly, mirroring a cautious sentiment that was also reflected in S&P 500 and Nasdaq futures. As reported by Investors Business Daily, the futures market signaled a sense of uncertainty, with investors digesting both the Supreme Court’s decision and a slate of big economic data scheduled for release before the market opened. The twin forces of legal and economic news created a complex backdrop, one that traders had to navigate with care.
“Big economic data is due before the open while the Supreme Court could issue a Trump tariffs ruling,” Investors Business Daily noted, highlighting the double whammy facing investors. The timing couldn’t have been tighter; the economic data, combined with the legal outcome, meant that the first minutes of trading would be anything but routine.
Against this backdrop, certain stocks made notable moves in after-hours trading on February 19. AI infrastructure leader Comfort Systems (FIX) saw its shares rise late on strong earnings, a rare bright spot in a market otherwise characterized by caution. Meanwhile, Akamai Technologies (AKAM) and Grail (GRAL) were among the session’s biggest losers, underscoring the volatility that has become a hallmark of earnings season.
But the drama wasn’t confined to the courtroom or the macroeconomic stage. On the corporate front, Tesla (TSLA) managed to grab headlines of its own by introducing a new $59,990 Cybertruck variant on February 19. While not directly tied to the Supreme Court’s decision, the move added another layer of intrigue to a week already packed with market-moving events. Tesla’s new offering was seen as a strategic play, aimed at broadening the appeal of its much-hyped electric truck and capturing a wider swath of the market.
For those watching the broader market, the interplay between legal decisions, economic indicators, and corporate news created a sense of whiplash. As the Dow Jones Index flickered on the big board at the New York Stock Exchange, traders scrambled to interpret what the Supreme Court’s ruling would mean for tariffs, international trade, and the broader economy. Would the decision offer clarity and stability, or would it inject fresh uncertainty into an already jittery market?
One thing was clear: the Supreme Court’s involvement in tariff policy—particularly measures put in place during the Trump administration—was no small matter. Tariffs have long been a flashpoint in debates over trade, economic growth, and America’s role in the global economy. By weighing in, the Court was not only shaping the legal landscape but also sending ripples through boardrooms and trading floors alike.
Meanwhile, the economic data released before the open added another layer of complexity. While the details of the data were eagerly awaited, market watchers understood that any surprises—positive or negative—could amplify the day’s volatility. For investors, it was a day to keep one eye on the ticker and the other on the headlines.

source_articles.title: FTSE 100 Gains as Retail Sales Beat Expectations and Surplus Hits Record - Meyka
source_articles.body:
FTSE 100 Gains as Retail Sales Beat Expectations and Surplus Hits Record
The FTSE 100 has shown strong upward momentum recently as the UK economy delivered surprisingly robust data on consumer spending and government finances. Retail sales in January 2026 rose much more than economists expected, and the UK recorded its largest monthly budget surplus on record, boosting investor confidence in the stock market. These developments contributed to rising share prices across major components of the FTSE 100 and offered investors renewed optimism about economic growth prospects in the UK.
Latest Economic Data Supporting the FTSE 100 Rally
Retail Sales Surge Beyond Forecasts
Recent official data confirmed that UK retail sales volumes rose by 1.8% month-on-month in January 2026, far surpassing the modest 0.2% increase expected by economists. This represented the strongest monthly rise since May 2024. On an annual basis, retail sales climbed 4.5% compared with a year earlier, well above consensus estimates. This strong performance was driven by robust demand in non-food retailers, including technology, automotive fuel, and speciality goods.
The unexpected strength in retail activity signals consumer resilience early in 2026, and this trend helped lift sentiment on the FTSE 100 as investors reacted to improved spending data. Higher retail sales imply stronger corporate earnings for major consumer brands and retailers listed on the index.
Historic Budget Surplus Boosts Market Confidence
Around the same time, the UK government reported a record budget surplus of £30.4 billion in January 2026, the highest monthly surplus since records began in 1993. This figure exceeded the forecast of around £24 billion and largely reflected strong tax receipts and reduced borrowing costs. Corporate tax payments, income tax contributions, and capital gains taxes all contributed to the increase.
A larger surplus suggests stronger public finances and may help ease concerns about government debt levels and future taxation. For investors, this signals an improving macro backdrop, which can support higher valuations on the FTSE 100.
FTSE 100 at Record Levels
The combined effects of retail data and fiscal strength helped send the FTSE 100 index to new record highs, reaching more than 10,686 points recently. This marked the index’s second consecutive all-time peak, propelled by strength in commodity and defence stocks as well as renewed support for domestically sensitive companies.
Sector Trends Within the Rally
Miners and Commodities
- Mining stocks such as Antofagasta and Anglo American saw gains of around 10.5% and 4.6% respectively in recent sessions.
- Companies like Glencore also boosted the index after reporting strong earnings and shareholder payouts.
Defence and Export-oriented Firms
- Defence giant BAE Systems climbed nearly 4% on strong earnings and a record order backlog exceeding £83.6 billion.
Commodity price strength and global demand for metals and defence equipment helped support these sectors, which carry significant weight within the FTSE 100.
Retail Sector’s Influence on Market Sentiment
The unexpected January rise in retail figures reflects regained spending momentum after weaker consumer activity in late 2025. Prior data showed a bounce back in retail sales volumes after years of more modest growth or even small declines in some months. For example, retail sales rose by 0.4% in December 2025, exceeding expectations after a fall in November.
Consumer confidence appeared bolstered by lower inflation pressures, and technology retailers and non-food sectors contributed strongly to the gains. Boosted retail demand can improve earnings projections for those companies contributing to FTSE 100 returns, further strengthening investor confidence.
Role of Global and UK Interest Rate Outlook
Market expectations of future central bank action have also influenced the FTSE 100’s performance. Cooling inflation in the UK has increased bets on interest rate c

source_articles.title: UBS sees selective opportunities in UK as recovery signals emerge - Investing.com
source_articles.body:
Investing.com | Author Navamya Acharya
Published Dec 31, 0000 07:00PM ET
Updated Feb 20, 2026 07:03AM ET
Investing.com -- UBS strategists said the UK equity market is showing early recovery signals but remains an "optional" destination for global capital, arguing that investors should focus on cash-return leaders and underowned small- and mid-cap stocks rather than broad index exposure, according to a UBS European Equity Strategy note dated Friday.
The FTSE 100 and FTSE 250, weighted by sector PMI New Orders, have both pivoted back to recovery after a temporary slowdown, driven by improvements in banks and consumer goods, UBS said.
The FTSE 100 has outperformed European peers since February 2025, while the FTSE 250 has trended higher, with UK large caps leading the Stoxx Europe 600, Russell UK Mid 150 and FTSE 250 ex-investment trusts on a rebased 12-month chart, according to the report.
Despite the improved momentum, UBS described the current setup as "a measured re-warm, not a chase," noting that style diagnostics still favor stock selection over index beta.
The UK’s persistent discount to European equities reflects structural rather than temporary factors, UBS said.
Domestic investors now own just approximately 20% of UK equities, with U.S. investors holding 44.1% and Luxembourg-domiciled funds accounting for 12.1%, according to Bloomberg data cited in the report.
UK defined benefit pension schemes have cut UK equity holdings from roughly one-third of assets in the mid-2000s to under 2% by 2023, leaving buybacks as the primary source of domestic demand.
FTSE 350 companies executed 187 buyback programs in 2025, up from 54 in 2018, according to Bloomberg data cited by UBS.
The UK’s weight in the MSCI ACWI has fallen approximately 6 percentage points over the past 16 years, compressing passive inflows and leaving the market reliant on active re-allocation decisions, UBS said, citing Bloomberg and MSCI data.
On valuation, UBS said the FTSE 100 trades largely in line with the S&P 500 and MSCI ACWI on a price-to-earnings-growth basis, meaning large caps are "not anomalously cheap, they are priced coherently with their trajectory."
FTSE 250 companies trade at materially lower PEG ratios than global peers, while also remaining deeply discounted on forward price-to-book relative to MSCI Europe, according to Datastream data in the report.
The 12-month forward relative P/E distribution for FTSE 100 constituents has become concentrated in the 75%-125% band, which UBS said argues against a blanket re-rating.
Earnings revisions for FY26 and FY27 remain net negative, though FY26 estimates have been revised marginally higher year-to-date, driven by materials sector upgrades.
Mining, banks and pharma are the primary engines of FY26 earnings per share growth, while energy is lagging. FY27 expectations have softened across most sectors, according to Datastream data cited by UBS.
UBS economists forecast UK GDP growth of 1.1% in 2026 and 1.4% in 2027, following 1.3% growth in 2025. CPI inflation fell to 3% year-on-year in January 2026 and is forecast to average 2% in 2026, with a sharp step-down expected in April when household energy bills are cut.
The Bank of England is expected to cut rates by 25 basis points each in March and June 2026 to a terminal rate of 3.25%, though UBS said risks are skewed toward further cuts below that level, citing BoE data.
Options markets have shifted from "conditional calm" to early risk hedging, while domestic outflows persist across active and passive UK equity fund categories.
Alternative long/short equity UK was the only UK equity fund type to record positive active inflows in the four weeks to Feb. 18, according to LSEG Lipper data cited in the report.

DAX Today, February 21: 25,000 Support Wobbles on Iran Tensions
DAX today opened on the back foot as Iran tensions, an oil price surge, and rate uncertainty weighed on risk appetite. After a brief push higher, the index faded to close 0.9% lower at 25,043, keeping the 25,000 support in focus. The ^GDAXI has tested this line repeatedly, while a stronger dollar pressures exporters. With geopolitical risks elevated and US rate-cut hopes cooling, we expect choppy sessions and tight ranges to define near-term trading for German investors.
Market Drivers: Geopolitics, Oil, and Rates
DAX today reflects rising risk aversion as Middle East tensions support crude and the US dollar. Higher oil lifts energy names but squeezes margins for transport and chemicals, while a firm dollar dampens exporters’ earnings translation. Local sentiment mirrors this push-pull setup, with investors rotating intra-day rather than adding broad exposure. See coverage from Handelsblatt and Tagesschau.
DAX today also faces rate uncertainty. Softer odds of early Fed cuts and a cautious ECB stance keep real yields firm, limiting multiple expansion. A stronger dollar tightens financial conditions for Germany’s export-heavy index, while earnings sensitivity remains high. With 25,000 support tested several times, buyers defend the floor, but conviction stays low given headline risk and a less generous rates backdrop.

DAX today sits on a critical area. The index touched a day low at 24,983 and settled near 25,043, underscoring defense of 25,000 support. Average True Range near 283 points signals brisk swings, while ADX at 15.8 implies no strong trend. In this setup, failed breaks are common, favouring tactical entries over directional bets until a decisive close clears key levels.

Strategy for German Investors This Week

source_articles.title: Let’s Talk About RFK Jr.’s Workout Pants - The Atlantic
source_articles.body:
This article was featured in the One Story to Read Today newsletter. Sign up for it here.
A post on X claimed to be a simple message from the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services: Stay active; eat well. But the 90-second video it shared, called “Secretary Kennedy and Kid Rock’s Rock Out Work Out,” seems designed to be bewildering. Here was Robert F. Kennedy Jr. eating steak and doing preacher curls in his belted blue jeans and a pair of hiking shoes; and here he was again, stripping off his T-shirt to ride an exercise bike inside a sauna; and here he was a little later, strutting over to a cold-plunge tub (still in his blue jeans but with the belt removed); and here he went into the tub, sliding underwater in his dungarees.
Why was the HHS secretary bathing in a pair of pants? The video never provides an answer for this question, even as Kennedy plays pickleball, then mugs for the camera, then soaks in a Jacuzzi with a glass of milk, all while still in jeans. It’s just bizarre—a PSA that presumably has been dialed in by his staff to maximize its WTF effect. (The video has been viewed more than 13 million times and produced some 11,000 replies; HHS did not respond to a request for comment about the video or the jeans.) However his peculiar gymwear habit started, its present state is very clear: The secretary’s jeans are self-aware.
Kennedy’s proclivity for working out in belted denim long predates the knowing wink with which it’s now displayed. Take the summer’s “DOD-HHS Fitness Challenge,” for which Kennedy donned his favorite workout gear and did a bunch of pull-ups with Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth. Or the viral clip of him from 2023, wearing jeans and boots and nothing else, squeezing out a final set on Venice Beach. I don’t believe that these show a man who lifts in jeans to maximize his clicks. I believe that they show instead a man who fits a waning archetype in fitness culture, a species that has for decades been endemic to the gym: Kennedy is a jeans guy.
I’ve worked out, off and on, for more than 30 years—and for all of that time, the jeans guys have remained a steady presence on the rubber floors. They are sometimes taciturn, sometimes chatty. They often pair their jeans with boots, as Kennedy will do, and with a T-shirt or a tank top or a hoodie. But lest you think he simply has no truck with any gym-specific gear, the jeans guy is sometimes spotted wearing padded lifting gloves, or a leather lifting belt across his Levi’s. At times, his social role will overlap with that of other weight-room regulars, not least of which is the gym grandpa, who hangs around and shoots the breeze and doles out tips on how to lift. However he appears, and however much he gabs, the jeans guy’s social status is the same: He’s an outsider. Rarely does one find a jeans guy paired up with a workout partner. “It’s usually like, ‘The jeans guy rides alone,’” Tolga Ozyurtcu, a historian of physical culture at the University of Texas at Austin, told me when I called him up to talk about this phenomenon.
Not everyone enjoys the company of the jeans guy. Some see him as a threat. Planet Fitness once made a point of banning denim in the gym, along with grunting, dropping dumbbells, and judging others. (Those who broke these rules could be punished with a “lunk alarm” and summarily kicked out.) But this discrimination feels as ill-considered as it is unfair: In my experience, jeans guys are harmless at the very worst, and at best, they add some needed color to a dreary landscape. In this way, the jeans guys are akin to other gentle curiosities, such as the shorts guys who alight on college campuses in wintertime, and the black chipmunks that scamper by from time to time in city parks.
What motivates the jeans guy? No one knows. He is, if nothing else, as inscrutable as a four-leaf clover. Ask him why he isn’t wearing shorts, and he will likely tell you that he chooses denim for efficiency. When Fox News’s Jesse Watters asked Kennedy i

source_articles.title: Obituary for Marie S. Samples - Ronald V. Hall Funeral Home
source_articles.body:
Mrs. Marie S. Samples, age 92, of Lyons, died Friday, February 20, 2026, at her home following an extended illness. She was a native of Montgomery County, living in Treutlen County and in Telfair County for many years before moving to Lyons in 1962. She was dedicated to Foskey Tire in Vidalia and retired after forty-eight years as office manager. She was a member of Marietta Free Will Baptist Church in the Blue Ridge Community. She enjoyed sewing and quilting.
She is preceded in death by her husband, Otis Lee Samples; daughter, Allison Ann Samples; parents, Edward Salter and Algia Allison Moseley Salter; and two sisters, Aileen Salter and Edith Salter Padgett.
Mrs. Samples is survived by two sons, Blaine Samples and wife Sandra of Metter, and Glynn Samples and wife Connie of Lyons; six grandchildren, Cole Samples and wife Katey of Lyons, Jeremy Coe of Savannah, Casey Coley and husband Chris of Lyons, Lauren Samples of Savannah, Katie Roberts and husband Roy, and Matthew Samples, all of Metter; eight great-grandchildren, Anneston, Case, Ridge, Cash, Crue, Olivia, Cameron, and Beau; and several nieces and nephews.
The funeral service will be held on Sunday afternoon, February 22nd, 2026, at 3:00 in the chapel of Ronald V. Hall Funeral Home with Pastor Ken Murphy and Pastor Reece Mincey officiating. Interment will follow at Lakeview Memorial Gardens.
The family will receive friends at the funeral home on Sunday afternoon from 1:00 until just prior to the service.
Those desiring may make memorial donations to the American Diabetes Association by visiting their website at diabetes.org.
The family will assemble at the residence of a son, Glynn Samples, 4193 Hwy 56 East, Lyons.
Ronald V. Hall Funeral Home of Vidalia is in charge of arrangements.
To send flowers
to the family or plant a tree
in memory of Marie S. Samples, please visit our floral store.

source_articles.body:

We'll notify you when service details or new memories are added.

Please select what you would like included for printing:
Michael Sheldon McClenning, 33, of Brunswick, Maryland, passed away on Saturday, February 14, 2026.
Born on August 29, 1992, Michael was a true small-town boy at heart. He was known for his stubborn determination, strong work ethic, and deep commitment to providing for his family. He worked tirelessly and took pride in making sure those he loved were cared for.
After graduating from Brunswick High School in 2011, Michael served in the United States Air Force for 11 years.
Michael shared his life with his wife, Dasia, and together they built a family rooted in love and devotion to their children, Miley and Rory. Being a father was Michael’s greatest pride. His daughter, Miley, and his son, Rory, were his world, and he loved them fiercely. The life they created together as a family meant everything to him.
He was also a devoted son. Michael shared a close and special bond with his mother, Angie. A true “momma’s boy” at heart, he loved her deeply, and their connection was one of loyalty, comfort, and unwavering love.
Michael found peace and joy outdoors. He loved fishing for smallmouth bass on the Potomac River, racing his GasGas dirt bike, and snowboarding fresh powder in Colorado. Whether on the river, the trail, or the mountain, he felt most alive in wide open spaces.
He is survived by his beloved children, Miley and Rory; his wife, D’Asia; his mother, Angie; his father, Scott; and his siblings, Chrissie, Thailer, Nick, Branden and Jennifer; his grandfather, Mike; and his grandmother, Cathy. He also leaves behind extended family, lifelong friends, and the Brunswick community that shaped him.
A viewing will be held from 10 a.m. to 12 p.m. on Thursday, February 26, 2026, at Stauffer Funeral Home, 1621 Opossumtown Pike in Frederick. Funeral services will begin at 12 p.m. on Thursday at the funeral home. Rev. Tim May will officiate. A repast to follow at 3 p.m. at an undisclosed location.
Michael was deeply loved as a son, brother, husband, and father, and his absence leaves an immeasurable void in the hearts of those who loved him most.

source_articles.title: "Japan's Yen Real Value Falls to 35% of 31 Years Ago... Becomes the Weakest Currency" - 아시아경제
source_articles.body:
Real Effective Exchange Rate at 67.73 in January
Lowest Level Since Adoption of Floating Exchange Rate System in 1973
In January, Japan's real effective exchange rate for the yen was recorded at 67.73, marking the lowest level since 1973, when the country adopted a floating exchange rate system.
Nihon Keizai Shimbun (Nikkei) reported on the 21st that the yen has significantly depreciated in value against global currencies. Compared with the peak of 193.95 in April 1995, the current value of the yen is only about one-third of that level.
The real effective exchange rate is an indicator that shows how much actual purchasing power a country's currency has compared with the currencies of other countries. When the figure is lower than in the base year, it means that the currency is relatively weak in international trade. Nikkei cited Japan's prolonged economic stagnation and its low interest rate policy as the background to the yen's weakness.
In the Tokyo foreign exchange market, the value of the yen has recently plunged against the dollar, with the dollar-yen exchange rate at one point rising to the low 155-yen range. Some speculative investors who had been driving yen buying have incurred unexpected losses and have begun unwinding their positions. Analysts say that long positions built in anticipation of possible Japanese government intervention in the foreign exchange market are being reduced due to the burden of mounting losses.
The interest rate gap between the United States and Japan is also a factor fueling the yen's weakness. While the Federal Reserve's benchmark interest rate stands at around 3.5% to 3.75% per year, Japan's rate is as low as 0.75%, leading to analysis that the attractiveness of holding yen is diminished in terms of real interest rates. As a result, international investors are shifting their funds into currencies such as the dollar, the euro, and the yuan, which offer higher operational efficiency.
Market experts predict that the yen's weak trend is unlikely to reverse in the near term unless the Bank of Japan further raises its benchmark interest rate or strengthens its hawkish monetary policy stance. They point out that for the yen to regain its status as a "safe-haven currency," a clear policy shift by Japan's financial authorities is necessary.
